summary: The document is an identification form from the John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Collection, detailing Robert Scheer's involvement in liberal political movements in the Bay Area during the 1960s. It highlights his participation in demonstrations, visits to Cuba and Cambodia, and his editorial role at Rampart Magazine. The record, unclassified but with deletions, was last reviewed in 1995.
key_findings: Robert Scheer was actively involved in liberal political movements and demonstrations in the 1960s.
He participated in events such as the San Francisco City Hall riots and was a member of the Vietnam Day Committee.
Scheer visited Cuba and wrote favorably of Castro, and later visited Cambodia.
There is no evidence linking Scheer to any subversive organizations against the US Government.
The document is part of the JFK Assassination Records, indicating a possible interest or surveillance by government agencies.
